stories.title: Peak Skeuomorphism: Online Events, Virtual Offices and Tinder

stories.text:
I was recently scouted with a pretty good offer from a company and they looked good on paper. But their app had 1.4-1.5 ratings on yelp and tripadvisor with walls of text from people with bad experiences. Their glassdoor was 4.5 but filled with ridiculous amount of 3-word 5 star reviews. That was pretty shady and I declined.

The experience made me curious, what are your (not so obvious) red flags when job hunting?
stories.title: Ask HN: What are your red flags in job listings?

stories.text:
Biden has signed a new executive order Promoting Competition in the American Economy: https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2021/07/09/fact-sheet-executive-order-on-promoting-competition-in-the-american-economy/

Among other things, the announcement says that it will "make it easier and cheaper to switch banks by requiring banks to allow customers to take their financial transaction data with them to a competitor".

Does it really mean that regulated open banking (like Europe) is coming to US or its still uncertain?
stories.title: Ask HN: What Biden's latest executive order means for open banking?
